Questions: Which of the following classes is used to perform basic console I/O?
The .dot operator connects the following two entities _____.
Correct Answer: A. a class member and a class object
Wrong Answer 1: B. a class object and a class
Wrong Answer 2: C. a class and a member of that class.
Wrong Answer 3: D. a class object and a member of that class.
Wrong Answer 4: A. a class member and a class object

Questions: Which of the following statements about abstract methods/classes in JAVA is true?
Correct Answer: A. An abstract class cannot be instantiated.
Wrong Answer 2: C. A subclass of an abstract class must defined the abstract methods..
Wrong Answer 3: D. Static methods may be declared abstract.
Wrong Answer 4: A. An abstract class cannot be instantiated.

Questions: When an instance of a class, or object, is specified as a parameter to a method, ______ to the said object is passed to the method.
An array of objects of a particular type, can have_______ type of objects.
When Java source code is compiled, each individual class is put into its own output file named after the class and using the ______ extension.
A class is declared by use of the ________ keyword.
The data or variables, defined within a class are called _______ variables.
You would use the ____ operator to create a single instance of a named class.

Correct Answer: B. Compiles and runs printing out The age is 1.
Wrong Answer 1: A. Compiles and runs with no output.
Wrong Answer 2: C. Compiles but generates a runtime error.
Wrong Answer 3: D. Compiles but generates a compile time error.
Wrong Answer 4: B. Compiles and runs printing out The age is 1.

Wrong Answer 1: B. Will compile successfully but with a warning message.
Wrong Answer 2: C. Will not compile - complains on an invalid expression.
Wrong Answer 3: D. Will show a warning message.

Questions:
Given the following member declarations, which statement is  true?
int a;                                                                                                         //(1)
static int a;                                                                                                               //(2)
int f() { return a; }                                                                       //(3)
static int f() { return a; }     //(4)

Wrong Answer 4: (d) The code will compile without error and will print 2 when run

Questions: Which of the following is not a valid statement?
Correct Answer:
(d)
Class methods can access instance variables or instance methods directly
Wrong Answer 1:
(a)
Instance methods can access instance variables and instance methods directly
Wrong Answer 2:
(b)
Instance methods can access class variables and class methods directly
Wrong Answer 3:
(c)
Class methods can access class variables and class methods directly
Wrong Answer 4:
(d)

Questions: Which of the following is  not true?
Correct Answer:
(b)
Every time the class is instantiated, a new copy of each of the class variables is created
Wrong Answer 1:
(a)
Every time the class is instantiated, a new copy of each of the instance variables is created
Wrong Answer 2:
(b)
Every time the class is instantiated, a new copy of each of the class variables is created
Wrong Answer 3:
(c)
A class has only one copy of each of its static members, which are shared by all the instances of the class
Wrong Answer 4:
(d)
Static members are accessed without an instance of a class
